questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abalize' is not standard. For 'stabilize' as context, which is opposite?
questions.explanation: To stabilize is to make stable; 'destabilize' is the technical opposite, meaning to make unstable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'accrete'?
questions.explanation: Accrete means to grow by gradual addition; 'erode' means to wear away gradually.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'aver'?
questions.explanation: To aver is to declare confidently; 'deny' is to state that something is not true.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'bolster'?
questions.explanation: To bolster is to support or strengthen; 'undermine' means to weaken or damage gradually.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'coalesce'?
questions.explanation: Coalesce means to come together into one; 'disperse' means to break apart and spread out.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'deference'?
questions.explanation: Deference is respectful submission; 'disrespect' is the direct behavioral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'dilatory'?
questions.explanation: Dilatory means slow or causing delay; 'prompt' means done without delay.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'engender'?
questions.explanation: Engender means to cause or give rise to; 'suppress' means to prevent or stop something from developing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'equivocal'?
questions.explanation: Equivocal means open to multiple interpretations; 'unambiguous' means having only one clear meaning.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'foment'?
questions.explanation: Foment means to stir up (trouble or rebellion); 'suppress' means to put an end to such activity.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'inure'?
questions.explanation: To inure is to accustom someone to something unpleasant; the opposite is to 'shock' or surprise strongly.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'mollify'?
questions.explanation: Mollify means to calm or soothe; 'inflame' means to make emotions more intense, especially anger.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obviate'?
questions.explanation: Obviate means to remove or prevent a need or difficulty; 'cause' implies bringing it about.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'protract'?
questions.explanation: Protract means to prolong; 'curtail' means to cut short.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rarefied'?
questions.explanation: Rarefied, figuratively, refers to something understood or enjoyed by a select group; 'common' suggests general, everyday access.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'recalcitrant'?
questions.explanation: Recalcitrant means stubbornly resisting authority; 'compliant' means willing to go along with rules.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'scant'?
questions.explanation: Scant means barely sufficient; 'ample' means more than enough.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'spendthrift' (as an adjective)?
questions.explanation: Spendthrift describes careless overspending; 'economical' means careful about spending.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'taciturn'?
questions.explanation: Taciturn means reserved and silent; 'talkative' means inclined to speak a lot.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'torpid'?
questions.explanation: Torpid means sluggish or inactive; 'energetic' is the strongest opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'umbrage'?
questions.explanation: To take umbrage is to take offense; 'pleasure' indicates a positive reaction instead of offense.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'upbraid'?
questions.explanation: Upbraid means to scold or criticize; 'praise' means to express approval.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'vex'?
questions.explanation: To vex is to annoy or irritate; 'soothe' means to calm or relieve irritation.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'wane'?
questions.explanation: Wane means to decrease in size or intensity; 'wax' is the traditional opposite, meaning to increase.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'zealous'?
questions.explanation: Zealous means showing great enthusiasm; 'indifferent' means having no particular interest or concern.
